  • Method Details

    • intersect

      public static boolean intersect(int[][] matrix, int[][] shape, int currentX, int currentY)
      Per-Cell Collision Detection This method implements precise per-cell collision checking. IMPORTANT: The brick shapes are stored as shape[row][col], but the original code accessed them as shape[col][row] (transposed). This method maintains that behavior to ensure compatibility with the existing coordinate system.
      Parameters:
      matrix - The game board matrix (matrix[row][col] or matrix[y][x])
      shape - The block's shape array (shape[row][col] in storage, but accessed as shape[col][row])
      currentX - The X position of the block's top-left corner
      currentY - The Y position of the block's top-left corner
      Returns:
      true if there's a collision, false if the move is safe

    • copy

      public static int[][] copy(int[][] original)

    • merge

      public static int[][] merge(int[][] filledFields, int[][] shape, int currentX, int currentY)
      Merge the brick into the board matrix using per-cell logic Uses the same transposed indexing as intersect() for consistency CRITICAL: This function MUST never write outside board boundaries. Any cell that would be outside bounds is silently skipped (not merged).

    • checkRemoving

      public static ClearRow checkRemoving(int[][] matrix)

    • deepCopyList

      public static List<int[][]> deepCopyList(List<int[][]> list)
